intro: Hedyotis bonincola, commonly known as the Bonin island geranium, is a flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and garden geraniums. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
